comment.author: 88500234@N02
comment._content: It is possible the wharf on the LHS is at Pyrmont Sydney Harbour. The building in the background is the old Navy stores at 12 / 14 Pyrmont where there was a huge railway shunting area.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/88500234@N02] Thank you for pointing that out Rons Finds! It looks like you're right, that building is still there and right near us, here at the Australian National Maritime Museum. Also saw this photo from Flickr user Kookaburra2011, which is a clearer view of the building along with a little history. The full source of the photo: Graeme Andrews, RAN 1955-1968, RANR 1980, it appears on the Naval Historical Society of Australia's two disc set 'Warships of the Past and Present,' compiled by Graeme, an Honourary Life Member of the Society.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
